body:
so there have always been leaving threads and their becoming more of a pain every day because everyone comes back. If people are leaving for good everyone should be showing sympathy and help. But so many recently have been fake and it's beginning to make people mad. There should be a stop to this. Maybe a longer punishment to enforce this. It's becoming a thing that people do for attention. As a lot of you may know, a member (not stating the name) came back literally 2 hours after. It's becoming too far. Opinions on this?



EDIT: After 5 times no one believes you anyone so we all know who those people are. There's a limit
body_tagged:
so there have always been leaving threads and their becoming more of a pain every day because everyone comes back. If people are leaving for good everyone should be showing sympathy and help. But so many recently have been fake and it's beginning to make people mad. There should be a stop to this. Maybe a longer punishment to enforce this. It's becoming a thing that people do for attention. As a lot of you may know, a member (not stating the name) came back literally 2 hours after. It's becoming too far. Opinions on this?



EDIT: After 5 times no one believes you anyone so we all know who those people are. There's a limit
title: Leaving threads

replies.body: I understand where you are coming from with this, but there is a thing that causes this to happen; regret. Sometimes people think it's the right thing to do, some others get put in a situation where they believe it's something that will help them if they leave. When everything works out for them they regret leaving and decide to come back. It's annoying that this keeps happening but I don't feel a perm ban isn't the right thing to do, maybe if they've done it multiple times that can be the punishment.
replies.body_tagged: I understand where you are coming from with this, but there is a thing that causes this to happen; regret. Sometimes people think it's the right thing to do, some others get put in a situation where they believe it's something that will help them if they leave. When everything works out for them they regret leaving and decide to come back. It's annoying that this keeps happening but I don't feel a perm ban isn't the right thing to do, maybe if they've done it multiple times that can be the punishment.

replies.body:
You see regarding fake leaving posts Dawson's just needed a little bit of air to think and get away I can understand that, but others e.g. Rilo, he repeatedly continued to post leaving posts and what happened about a few hours - 24 hours later? He came back.

So in my opinion regarding leaving posts it should be a one time thing not like other people making multiple leaving posts or even just straight out fake ones it really needs to stop and a punishment must be put in place.

replies.body: Honestly, I think that they should have to clear leaving posts with staff before they are made. It'd give the chance for staff to remind them of the consequences if they are fake, and that they should list that it might only be temporary.
replies.body_tagged: Honestly, I think that they should have to clear leaving posts with staff before they are made. It'd give the chance for staff to remind them of the consequences if they are fake, and that they should list that it might only be temporary.

replies.body: Please make leaving posts punishable.
replies.body_tagged: Please make leaving posts punishable.

replies.body:
Change is never a step but a process - anyone who thinks they can just go and leave Minecraft forever with a couple of deleted files and a leaving thread is either inexperienced or unable to learn from their mistakes. 

Successful cases are rare - and the person probably moved on to another game, or had an amazing amount of self control.

It's why all these leaving threads, because people are busy with life, motivated to quit gaming, whatever the reason may be, are all complete bs.

I thought I could quit Minecraft like that - many times failed miserably, a couple of times came close, one time almost completely succeeded - but in the end I'm still here. I have definitely weaned off a lot and am able to control my playing time but it took me over half a year.
replies.body_tagged:
Change is never a step but a process - anyone who thinks they can just go and leave Minecraft forever with a couple of deleted files and a leaving thread is either inexperienced or unable to learn from their mistakes. 

Successful cases are rare - and the person probably moved on to another game, or had an amazing amount of self control.

It's why all these leaving threads, because people are busy with life, motivated to quit gaming, whatever the reason may be, are all complete bs.

I thought I could quit Minecraft like that - many times failed miserably, a couple of times came close, one time almost completely succeeded - but in the end I'm still here. I have definitely weaned off a lot and am able to control my playing time but it took me over half a year.

replies.body:
Leaving posts are meant to inform the community that you are either departing from Avicus or Minecraft as a whole. I feel a lot of people just post a leaving thread for attention or to be noticed. If you are making a leaving post, you shouldn't care that you are banned, you have left anyway. Leaving for a temporary amount of time is different, no need for a whole thread about a temporary departure.

I think people just seek attention when making these "fake leaving posts" is what I'm trying to get at here.

I think people just seek attention when making these "fake leaving posts" is what I'm trying to get at here.

If FightToWin would eventually have the time to come back and rejoin, would you ban him? I think it's unfair.
